/wiki/Sahel_SC: Sahel Sporting Club is a Nigerien football club based in Niamey. The club was formed in 1974 from the football club Secteur 7.
/wiki/AS_Niamey: Association Sportive Niamey, commonly referred to as AS Niamey, is a Nigerien association football club based in Niamey. AS Niamey has won the Niger Premier League three times in his history .
/wiki/Olympic_FC_de_Niamey: Olympic FC de Niamey is a Nigerien football club based in Niamey. Their home games are played at Général Seyni Kountché Stadion. The club was formed in 1974 from the football club Secteur 6.
/wiki/Jangorzo_FC: Jangorzo FC is a Nigerien football club based in Maradi. Their home games are played at Stade de Maradi.
/wiki/Espoir_FC_(Niger): Espoir FC is a Nigerien football club based in Zinder. Their home games are played at Stade de Zinder.
/wiki/JS_du_T\u00e9n\u00e9r\u00e9: JS du Ténéré is a Nigerien football club based in Niamey. Their home games are played at Général Seyni Kountché Stadion.
/wiki/AS_Police_(Niamey): Association Sportive Police, commonly referred to as AS Police, is a Nigerien association football club based in Niamey and sponsored by the Nigerien National Police. Founded in 1993, AS Police won the Niger Premier League and the Niger Cup double in 2008.
/wiki/AS_FAN_Niamey: Association Sportive des Forces Armées Nigériennes or simply AS FAN is a Nigerien football club based in Niamey and operated by the Nigerien Armed Forces (the FAN). They play at the stade du camp Bagagi Iya, a small stadium in one of Niamey's military bases, although larger matches are played at the stade Général Seyni Kountché. Their current club president is Army Lieutenant Colonel Djibrilla Hima Hamidou (called Colonel Pélé).
